title: Race-2-1 Game Theory
hypothesis: A deterministic optimal strategy exists for the 'Race to 21' additive game, grounded in modular arithmetic (target = 4n + 1).
methodology: Implemented a Minimax-style algorithm for the AI opponent. Built a responsive React UI to visualize the game state and 'winning' vs 'losing' positions in real-time.
delta: Demonstrates how abstract mathematical concepts can be gamified into an intuitive user experience with zero-latency state management.

title: SEPTA COVID Recovery
hypothesis: The pandemic's impact on transit ridership was not uniform; route-specific analysis reveals localized recovery patterns.
methodology: Built a Python ETL pipeline to ingest daily SEPTA ridership data (2014-2025). Visualized trends using Recharts. Implemented mode-based filtering (Bus vs Rail).
delta: Transforms complex CSV dumps into an interactive dashboard. Reveals disparate recovery rates across different city sectors.

title: PA Attendance Analytics
hypothesis: Longitudinal clustering of school districts reveals chronic absenteeism trends that are invisible in aggregate annual reports.
methodology: Ingested 8 years of raw Excel child-accounting data. Engineered 'Lost Instructional Time' metrics. Used K-Means clustering to group districts by attendance profiles.
delta: Complete data-to-web pipeline. Processed 2001-2009 data into accessible insights. Highlights districts at risk of missing 95% targets.

title: MOND Physics Engine
hypothesis: Modified Newtonian Dynamics (Milgrom 1983) can be accurately simulated in real-time using the simple interpolation function ν(y) = 0.5 + √(0.25 + 1/y).
methodology: Ported C physics engine to JavaScript with custom WebGL shaders. Implemented leapfrog integration for orbital stability. Optimized for 60fps with 500+ particles.
delta: Successfully demonstrates the flat rotation curve phenomenon without dark matter. Interactive visualization powering this portfolio.
